definition: simplified Chinese character
simple/uncomplicated/letter/to choose/to select/bamboo strips used for writing (old)
to make into/to change into/-ization/to ... -ize/to transform/abbr. for 化學|化学[hua4 xue2]
variant of 花[hua1]
letter/symbol/character/word/CL:個|个[ge4]/courtesy or style name traditionally given to males aged 20 in dynastic China

sentences.english: The first one, all of us have familiar with simple-formed characters.
sentences.chinese: 首先，所有的人都对简化字很熟悉。

sentences.english: Who Can Benefit from This Guide of Traditional and Simplified Chinese Characters?
sentences.chinese: 谁应该使用这个繁体字和简化字指南？

sentences.english: The change process of Chinese traditional and simplified characters was proposed.
sentences.chinese: 中华汉字繁体字与简化字的变革过程。

sentences.english: Simplified Chinese characters don't contain any variant forms of these characters.
sentences.chinese: 经过改革后的简化字基本不再使用异体字。

sentences.english: I do not think we should use complex-formed characters to instead of simple-formed characters.
sentences.chinese: 我不认为我们应该用繁体字来代替简化字。

definition: variant Chinese character
simplified Chinese character, as opposed to traditional Chinese character 繁體字|繁体字[fan2 ti3 zi4]
standard form of a Chinese character/(Tw) traditional (i.e. unsimplified) characters
nonstandard form of a Chinese character
traditional Chinese character
nonstandard form of a Chinese character
see 注音符號|注音符号[zhu4 yin1 fu2 hao4]
Mandarin phonetic symbols (MPS), phonetic alphabet for Chinese used esp. in Taiwan, also known colloquially as Bopomofo (after the first four letters of the alphabet:ㄅㄆㄇㄈ)
phonetic alphabet/alphabetic writing system
everyday words
to indicate the pronunciation of Chinese characters using Pinyin or Bopomofo etc/phonetic notation/(specifically) Bopomofo (abbr. for 注音符號|注音符号[zhu4 yin1 fu2 hao4])
old character/archaic form of a Chinese character
the small or lesser seal, the form of Chinese character standardized by the Qin dynasty
ideograph/ideographical writing system
romanization
to use letters/to use words/diction
